snippet: A video showing a small-town judge threatening to jail traffic violators who could not immediately pay their fines led to intervention by the Southern Center for Human Rights.
abstract: Cellphone video showing Bowdon, Ga, Judge Richard A Diment threatening defendants with jail time if they could not pay traffic violation fines has led to scrutiny and promises of change; United States Supreme Court has ruled defendants cannot be jailed if they are unable to pay fines, but advocates say ruling is often overlooked.
lead_paragraph: A video showing a small-town judge threatening to jail traffic violators who could not immediately pay their fines led to intervention by the Southern Center for Human Rights.

headline.main: A Surreptitious Courtroom Video Prompts Changes in a Georgia Town
headline.print_headline: Surreptitious Video of a Judge’s Threats Leads to Changes in a Georgia Town
